Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I had no idea when I got in that car and headed to New York I was going to quit. I got on that ramp and I thought two hours, two hours to go. Feeling good. Listen to some tunes. Should've peed before I left.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Michael get to the good part.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, so. I get up to the building, I get to the revolving door... broken! So I have to take the normal door.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: At least he is in the building.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, No! I was so nervous it was the wrong building! I walked into the wrong building!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He finally has a story everyone wants to hear... and he knows it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay focus. Focus. You're in the right building, you're with the right people; what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I looked at Wallace and I said "I quit!" and as I turned to leave I looked back and I said "You have no idea how high I can fly."

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Did you tell him how sick of him you were?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why would I do that?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, wouldn't it feel good to tell him that he was incompetent?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That he's wasted 15 years of your life?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Did you spit in his face?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys have thought about this a lot more than I have. I just winged it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I love a good quitting story. It makes me feel like I have control over my own life. Gives me hope. Maybe I will have one of own someday. [laughs] But I dream... so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael has a 'sticky-hand' toy and snags a paper off Jim's desk and then laughs] About a week ago, Michael gave his 2-week notice. And, surprisingly there is a very big difference between Michael trying and Michael not trying.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael is that scotch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Scotch with Splenda. Tastes like Splenda, gets you drunk like scotch. [in Oscar's ear] Clinky, clinky-clink. Come-on... come on, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [slightly drunk] What am I gonna do? I'll tell ya what I'm gonna do. I gonna do a little bit of this, a little bit of that. I gonna stay up all day. Gonna sleep it up all night. I'm gonna give it a OHH! HEY! HO! And I'm going to stop worrying about calories.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Maybe you should go into your office, close the door, and make some calls about jobs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: For four more days.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you have any leads on a job?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, what you don't understand is that at my level you just don't look in the want-ads for a job. You are head-hunted.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You called any headhunters?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Any good headhunter knows I am available.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Any really good headhunter would storm your village at sunset with overwhelming force and cut off your head with a ceremonial knife,

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right, cause that's what we are talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Uh, I need you to go over this client list and indicate any wrong or false data.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're 'I need you to' is my command.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can talk to me for as long as you want. I have all the time in the world. [eats some spaghetti] Oh God! Blech! Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just wanted to tell you that... Oh What? [takes a present out from behind his back] What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Hey. What is this about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, you know, cause your leaving and so, it's a farewell...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I hope I get to work with you someday again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Me too, me too. Is this wine?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah... busted. Yes

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I already have wine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: [interviewee enters office] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Isaac Silby here for the interview

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, yes. Please have a seat. It'll be a few minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Thank you. [to Michael] You interviewing too?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Interviewing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For?

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes I am.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: For regional manager I've decided to go with an outside hire. For obvious reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where you from?

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Philly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a drive!

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Yeah, well this is one of the few places that's hiring. It's uh, its brutal out there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When will the new copier be ready?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm working on it Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You said it would be ready by today. And it is today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It'll be ready soon.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Soon could mean anything. Soon could be 3 weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is that what 'soon' means to you?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then come back soon.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: During the course of business, a copier goes though something called 'Normal wear and tear.'

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [feeding coins into a vent] I think it's 75 cents.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Bandit is chewing on wires] Bandit, No! No no no!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [dumps coffee all over the copier glass] Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yesterday, they delivered the new one. But they didn't set it up. So my day just got a little more interesting. [holds up a huge manual]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [overhears loud monster noises] Its Monster dot com. Singular.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. [groaning ceases]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You work in paper long enough, you get to know the players. [dials phone]

Quote.Speaker: Phone
Quote.Text: Hi, you've reached Prince Paper. We are sad to inform you that after 40 years of serving the community we are no longer in business. Thank you for your support. May God bless you. [girl's voice] Bye!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] What am I gong to do? Uh... [chuckles].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: PSST! PSST!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah... .you want me to come in your office? Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, oh okay, okay. Close your eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I would prefer not to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just close your eyes. I'm going to start my own paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're starting your own paper company?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you believe... cause I know paper. I know everything there is to know about paper.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you know the industry is in decline?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! Oh God. I practically invented decline.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right, I know paper, I know how to manage. I have a name, close your eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I did that before, it added nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Close them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. [keeps eyes open]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, Michael Scott Paper Company. You want in? Do you want to be a part of this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am not gonna do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Obviously.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And you are not going to, either.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, agreed, mmm, except...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here's the thing. What I wish for you is that you land a job at a company that A, exists, and B, has a salary. Because they're set up to do that kind of thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey hey... what's up Chuck?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing, just talking.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael handed in his 2-week notice, did you also hand in your 2-week?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't... no.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay. After you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No I'm staying.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [examining the copier manual] Do you want me to translate the German instructions for you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I'm sure they're pretty much the same as the English instructions.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Typical American ignorance that got us involved in a war we never should have been in. World War II.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a really... well fine, Do the German instructions say what this is supposed to do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Deutsch... let me see here. That is either an incense dispenser, or a ceremonial sarcophagus.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My German is pre-industrial and mostly religious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, listen. This order form. Instead of saying "Dunder Mifflin" at the top is there any way I could get it to say something else?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like Michael Scott Paper Company?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You... oh. Somebody has been talking in bed. Pillow talk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm... yeah. Listen Michael. Have you really thought this through? 'Cause it's a pretty big risk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a dream that I have had since lunch, and I am not giving up on it now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah... you could give it up though right? And almost nobody would know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Before you got here, I'm the one who landed all these clients. Half of them, at least. I can do it again. I know the market, I know the price points. I'm on it, don't worry. So, how do I do that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, um, you can scan it, and then you can upload the image, and then you can copy the new image.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can't I take some paper and just tape over it with transparent tape?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So that is why I have to leave at 5:

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I am aware of the effect I have on woman.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So you should be heading back to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. Bye Charles. Well you'll let me know. Good bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She's such a special person. And she's turning 50 this year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm starting my own paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No way!?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In this climate?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. In all climates. It's going to be worldwide. And I'm looking for some talented salesmen to join me. That's where you come in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ehh... [in accent] well it's a very intriguing concept, isn't it? Um... hmmm..[makes weird noises to stall, Dwight enters] Michael is starting his own paper company. What do you think about that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your own paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you believe it? Well, we'll see, we'll see. It's just a, just a nugget of an idea right now so

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Potential, lots of potential. yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What a courageous venture.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's... it's very courageous, very exciting. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Location is hard for me, with the farm and the responsibilities...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what I was thinking, with the farm, so... You getting to wherever I'm gonna put my thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. So yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So think about it. Lets put a pin in it for now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, I would love to put a pin in that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Everyone, can I have your attention. This is the moment you've all been waiting for. Right? [drum roll on copier]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Little Ms. Thing wants attention.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Meredith... [copier has an error] Oh... so uh... G-44. It's not ready Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm at a crucial point where I have sunk 4 hours into that copier, and I am not going to let it beat me like that wireless router did.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [bites his sandwich and notices there is a note in it]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You put a note in my food?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I made it sterile.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Just to say "sterile" doesn't make it so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am offering you the opportunity of a lifetime, Oscar. To come work for me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do you have a business plan? A funding request? Market research, financials?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no no.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You need those things. Most new businesses, they don't make a profit till at least two years. And then your margins will be razor thin. Best case scenario, you don't cut yourself a salary for at least 5 years. Can you go 5 years without a salary, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Five years?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, hey, you already have the job. You don't have to convince me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's just not prudent Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [from inside the restroom] Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Can't you see I'm urinating?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen, Listen, Stanley. You don't have to answer me now.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just... I want you to think about it, I'm starting my own company.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh-okay, you're not letting me finish, and you just lost out on a million dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No I didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what. I had a great time at prom. And no one said 'Yes' to that either.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How's it working?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Um, let's see... it's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I did it. I learned everything about this machine. I know all the buttons, even the inside ones. I know all the error messages. I could do a bound book, in plastic with offset colors. Which feels...

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hey Hank, You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I can't pretend I haven't seen that. So I am going e to ask you to stand up, walk out. And you can't take anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I have immunity. It's my two-weeks...

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: not if you're starting your own paper company, Michael. Hank...

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Okay Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hank? You really think Hank is going to be loyal to you? Hank, please escort Charles from the building.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Come on man, let's, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I always thought Michael got a bad rap. He's a good guy. And he's super funny. Yeah, maybe I should tell him before he goes. He's all the way over there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to everyone] Well here we are... I would just like to...

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: No, no no no. You're done, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [yelling from Parking lot] Alright then everybody, I'm outta here!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [from behind the upstairs window] What is he doing? It looks like he's saying something.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think he's singing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can't believe this is really happening.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... and I feel free!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And just like that. As mysteriously as he arrived, he was gone. [Michael sneaks back in the parking lot, and into a back door of the building]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The whole office feels darker, you know? It's just a sad dark day.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy He's gone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You don't have to kiss his ass anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael is like a movie on a plane. You know, it's not great, but it's something to watch. And when it's over you're like... how much time is left on this flight? Now what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Michael is Army crawling around the office] Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh shh shh... don't look down, look straight up. Come on please!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: These are for employees only.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Angela Kevin, you have to help me out I just need a few things then I will be gone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, why is it that you asked everyone except me, Angela, Creed, and Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was going to, I wanted to. But I had to start somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But you didn't want to start with us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, of course not. But now I want everybody. Jim! Jim? Buddy, Hey! Buddy, Jimbo? Did you have time to think about my offer?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I did have a chance to think about it, but then I thought about something else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So which way are you leaning?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well it is tempting but I am 100% leaning towards something else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hey, did anyone see the client list that Michael was supposed to be working on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, let me know if you find it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Okay, we don't have much time. Just act normal. Don't look at me people. Stop. Don't look down. Don't look down. He's going to see me. Don't look all the way up. Keep it at a normal height. Okay. This is not Michael Scott talking right now, this is your future. Hello, I am your future. You're older, and you are very happy now. Because you went with Michael Scott. Right. So everybody come on down. Lets just crawl out of here together. Alright? Come on! Are you, are you doing your best here? Are you being the best that you can be? [Pam is thinking hard] Alright. Everybody who's going to go with me I want you to stomp your foot. Okay, alright. Come on. You're coming with me. Come on Phyllis. Here we go, here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Michael get up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God... okay alright. It's time to go it's time to go. Jim, let's go. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Michael, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think maybe Hank should be here.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hank? No, I don't need Hank Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're going to mess with me, is that what you're going to do? I'll tell you something Charles, I don't even care. Cause I've got nothing got lose. [Charles steps towards Michael] Oh my God, OH GOD! No no, all right. Fine, it's not even worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm going with him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm going.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam! You can't be serious.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, wait! I'm coming with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. It's going to be great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great. Uh, except, I don't want to be a receptionist anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right... Executive assistant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, okay. Deal! Okay, well... Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Still no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, okay, lets go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, all my stuff is still upstairs so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are people watching?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Probably.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, its not how you leave in an office. It how you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim Jim Jim... we're having a company meeting here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll bring your stuff home. Okay, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: So, we had a personnel change today. Shouldn't effect our day to day. But, until we get a new receptionist I want Kevin on the phones.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Phones?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Also, there has been too much wasted time. So Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [holding a crossword puzzle] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yeah, I want you to be on top of that okay? I want you to be my productivity czar. Okay, good. Uh, okay that it on my list. So uh, you know, no excuses guys. Lets get going okay? [everyone leaves except Kevin and Stanley, who are sitting stunned in their chairs]
